intro: Weihea celastroides, commonly known as the Tahitian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the islands of French Polynesia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow or orange flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or limestone soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in tropical gardens and landscapes.
